item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 24, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Frosted Glass from Games to the Web: HTML glass UI inspired by AAA game dev (396 points | 81 comments)
2. Evidence of oldest known alphabetic writing unearthed in ancient Syrian city (268 points | 182 comments)
3. Bocker: Docker implemented in around 100 lines of Bash (2015) (258 points | 77 comments)
4. Which Power Plant Does My Electricity Come From? (67 points | 26 comments)
5. How to give a senior leader feedback without getting fired (260 points | 216 comments)
6. A 132-Year-Old Message in a Bottle in a Scottish Lighthouse (27 points | 13 comments)
7. Minecraft enters real world with $110M global theme park deal (41 points | 24 comments)
8. Jiga (YC W21) Is Hiring Operations Coordinator ( | hide)
9. Foursquare's 104M Points of Interest (66 points | 21 comments)
10. Highest-resolution images ever captured of the sun’s surface (448 points | 120 comments)
11. Antenna Diodes in the Pentium Processor (210 points | 30 comments)
12. 32k context length text embedding models (61 points | 20 comments)
13. Three hundred words you can spell on a calculator [pdf] (58 points | 18 comments)
14. Undersea Cables Connect the Global Internet (9 points | 3 comments)
15. Supreme Court allows multibillion-dollar class action to proceed against Meta (104 points | 45 comments)
16. Continuous Integration Dashboard for Apache NuttX RTOS (Prometheus and Grafana) (62 points | 1 comment)
17. Robot Jailbreak: Researchers Trick Bots into Dangerous Tasks (29 points | 5 comments)
18. 1 Dataset. 100 Visualizations (144 points | 42 comments)
19. A century later, a taped message solves the mystery of a WWI doughboy's death (59 points | 32 comments)
20. Size and albedo of the largest detected Oort-cloud object (101 points | 43 comments)
21. Using GPS in the Year 1565 (179 points | 26 comments)
22. Stack Analyser: detect technologies used inside a repo (48 points | 7 comments)
23. Firefox DevTools Network Tab: How to filter requests by properties (60 points | 4 comments)
24. Quake 3 Source Code Review: Network Model (2012) (303 points | 75 comments)
25. Ice base melt revealed by multibeam imagery of an Antarctic ice shelf (91 points | 3 comments)
26. The remarkable life and astonishing times of Dwight Smith Young (36 points | 2 comments)
27. A short introduction to Interval Tree Clocks (2017) (67 points | 19 comments)
28. OpenMPTCProuter: Aggregate and encrypt multiple internet connections using MPTCP (148 points | 36 comments)
29. Microsoft will soon let you clone your voice for Teams meetings (40 points | 31 comments)
30. Dear sir, you have built a compiler (2022) (363 points | 200 comments)
